alert.note: Alert for Cascades in Lane County; Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 2:37AM PST until November 19 at 5:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM SATURDAY TO 5 PM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow and gusty winds expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches, with the heaviest snow accumulations above 5000 feet in elevation. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Elevations above 4000 feet across the Northern Oregon Cascades and Cascades in Lane County. * WHEN...From 7 PM Saturday to 5 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The combination of heavy snow and gusty winds will result in periods of poor visibility. The combination of slick roads and poor visibility will make travel difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, leading to isolated power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Pass level snow accumulations are expected to be 2 to 5 inches for Government Camp, with 5 to 10 inches expected for Santiam and Willamette Passes.
info.instruction: Travelers should carry chains and be prepared for winter travel conditions. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Cascades in Lane County; Northern Oregon Cascades
